title: County /Quarter Aggregate Recruitment Data -

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I would like an extract of all new active-duty recruits/ enlistments to the Armed Forces of the United States by county of origin for each quarter between 2000 and 2023. I would prefer it broken down by military branch.

I request the following fields:
- Number of enlistments in county 
- Branch of the military
- Quarter
- Year 

I request the information in .csv or a similar format rather than PDF. I am a researcher interested in studying popular culture and military recruitment.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Esteban Manuel Fernandez

title: Internal procedures for redress

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Internal procedures for redress
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide your internal procedures for redress—particularly to address complaints from protected persons regarding personally identifiable information about them that is shared between officers and/or agents, including but not limited to whether that information is requested, shared, received, or sent in any manner.

Please provide the badge numbers, job titles, legal names, rank weight, height, age, date of birth, race and addresses of Franklin Police Officers or agents who have access to personally identifiable information, including but not limited to whether that information is requested, shared, received, or sent in any manner.

Please disclose the badge numbers, job titles, legal names, rank weight, height, age, date of birth, race and addresses of the supervisory chain, from immediate supervisor to the top, of the Franklin Police Officers or agents who have access to personally identifiable information, including but not limited to whether that information is requested, shared, received, or sent in any manner.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Shawn Craig.

title: Contracts, Vendor Payment Report, Invoices - CA's Mortgage Settlement Monitor

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Contracts, Vendor Payment Report, Invoices - CA's Mortgage Settlement Monitor
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The following records pertaining to compensation or other expenditures directed to or claimed by Ms. Katherine M. Porter, appointed as California's monitor of the nationwide housing settlement in March 2012 by then-California Attorney General Kamala Harris:

(1) two contracts (including a series of five amendments to one of them)
(2) a vendor payment report; and
(3) 24 invoices sent to the Department of Justice pursuant to the contracts

There should be no need to conduct a lengthy search, as these are the exact records that were identified, enumerated, and subsequently provided free of charge in PDF form in 2018 by then-Deputy Attorney General Paul Stein, in response to a CPRA request first submitted by Kristopher Anderson on March 15, 2018 and further clarified by Mr. Anderson on March 26, 2018 (SEE PRA-2018-00629, California Attorney General CPRA requests in 2018 (January-July), available online at https://archive.org/details/5682291-California-Ag-Cpra-Log-201801-201807/page/n215/mode/2up).  

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

title: Paula Sladewski Case (Miami-dade Fire Rescue)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Paula Sladewski Case (Miami-dade Fire Rescue)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all records/photos/videos/audio and other materials related to the disappearance and death investigation of Paula Sladewski. (Reported missing and body identified on January 3, 2010)

Including, but not limited to:
- Reports from Medical Examiner 
- Surveillance footage from approx 7am-8am from Space Club showing Kevin Klym and then Paula Sladewski leaving with an unknown male
- Incident reports from discovery of body
- Police reports about attempt to file missing person report
- Correspondence about FDLE taking over the case
- Other investigative reports

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Rob Vernier

communications.subject: RE: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Paula Sladewski Case (Miami-dade Fire Rescue)
communications.communication:
Good morning Robert,

Upon further review, the incident location occurred outside of Miami-Dade Fire Rescue’s jurisdiction. The incident address is in the City of Miami Fire Department’s jurisdiction, which is a separate entity from us. Please contact the City of Miami Fire Department at (305) 416-1600 or (305) 416-1684 or via their website at https://www.miamigov.com/Government/Public-Records-Request . They will provide you with the information you need to submit your request for public records to them.  

If you would like to submit a new public records request, please feel free to visit us at Miami Dade County Public Records Portal<https://miamidadecounty.govqa.us/WEBAPP/_rs/(S(jmavijdlvrybengkbmfytb5g))/RequestLogin.aspx?sSessionID=&rqst=13&target=YpURA3m6cNU+N1K9kEqQhqz8yC2ZLKNdSdB4wnowVJ5S8CGTBp2GIItHg4/I0pUM8Jvp1AAd4YheCcTrA795fG9P3xL5LmB/wFQjiIoSWN5N2BU5BP3vNM6KgCTa2QWSX+SbwBiqbvMWsITZWuxFug==>.

communications.subject: FDLE Office of General Counsel
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting the Florida Department of Law Enforcement Office of General Counsel. This message is being provided as confirmation your message was received. You should receive a response to your inquiry as soon as possible.


If you need criminal history records, please visit our website, https://www.fdle.state.fl.us/Criminal-History-Records/Obtaining-Criminal-History-Information.aspx, and/or contact FDLE’s Criminal History Services Section at ApplicantChecks@fdle.state.fl.us<mailto:ApplicantChecks@fdle.state.fl.us> or (850) 410-8161.

Public records requests are processed in the order that they are received. Processing time may be lengthened due to the nature and extent of the request. Searches may be negative and FDLE may not have records responsive to your public records request. You may also receive an invoice for your request depending on the nature and extent of your public records request. Please feel free to contact us at (850) 410-7676, or publicrecords@fdle.state.fl.us, if you have additional specific information relating to the records you are requesting, as this may help expedite your request and/or reduce costs that may be associated with the request.

Additional information regarding how to obtain public records including what costs may be applicable is contained from the hyperlink below. We are committed to our fundamental values of Service, Integrity, Respect, and Quality.

For Additional Information click http://www.fdle.state.fl.us/OGC/Public-Records.aspx<https://www.fdle.state.fl.us/OGC/Public-Records.aspx>

communications.subject: Thank you for your email.
communications.communication:
Thank you for your email.



If you are submitting a request for public records, FCPS will respond to your request within 5 working days of its receipt. Please be aware that FCPS may notify you that it requires an additional 7 working days to provide a complete response. A working day is a day in which FCPS offices are open. FCPS central office hours are 8 a.m. - 4:30 p.m. Requests submitted after working hours or at times FCPS central offices are closed will be marked as received on the next FCPS working day. Day one is considered the first working day after a request has been received.


FOIA Office
Office of Communications & Community Relations
Fairfax County Public Schools
8115 Gatehouse Road
Falls Church, VA 22042

communications.subject: VFOIA-9250 Response
communications.communication:
Tom Nash,

Thank you for submitting your Virginia Freedom of Information Act (VFOIA) request, which was received by Fairfax County Public Schools (FCPS) on August 22, 2023.  Please see attached for reference.

In your request you seek:

"Copy of all FOIA/Public Records Requests received by Fairfax County Public Schools with the word "Thoreau" included in the request, for the time period January 1, 2017, through January 1, 2020, and a complete electronic copy of the responses to these FOIA Requests (including the public records themselves, when applicable)."
FCPS FOIA Office conducted a diligent search of our FOIA records. Please be advised that no responsive records were located.

Thank you,


FOIA Office<https://www.fcps.edu/about-fcps/policies-regulations-and-notices/virginia-freedom-information-act-vfoia/freedom>

communications.subject: Public Information Act Request :: R112227-082023
communications.communication:
Dear Lewis Manning: 
 
Thank you for your interest in the public records of the Austin Police Department. Your request has been received and is being processed. Your request was received in this office on 8/20/2023 and given the reference number R112227-082023 for tracking purposes. 
Please be advised that the Austin Police Department’s Central Records Division receives over 2500 requests for information a month. These requests are processed in the order received, and we strive to respond to each request promptly, as required by law. 
Please know that, as a result of the large volume of requests received, the anticipated timeframe for responding to your request may take 10 business days if it is simply an offense report you're requesting.  If you are requesting body cam, dash cam, or other related records your request could take up to 30 days. 
You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records requested. PLEASE NOTE: The Texas Public Information Act does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Austin Public Records Center. 
Austin Police Department

communications.subject: DEA FOIA/PA Case Number: 23-00990-F
communications.communication:
Dear Sam Hall: This e-mail responds to your Freedom of Information Act/Privacy Act (FOIA/PA) request dated August 22, 2023, received by the Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA), FOIA/PA Unit, seeking access to DEA records.  Your request has been opened and assigned the following case number: 23-00990-F.  Please include this case number when communicating with this office. The records you seek require searches in another office or offices, and so your request falls within "unusual circumstances."  See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(B)(i)-(iii).  Because of these unusual circumstances, we are extending the time limit to respond to your request beyond the ten additional days provided by the statute.  We have not yet completed a search to determine whether there are records within the scope of your request.  The time needed to process your request will necessarily depend on the complexity of our records search and on the volume and complexity of any records located.  For your information, this office assigns incoming requests to one of three tracks:  simple, complex, or expedited.  Each request is then handled on a first-in, first-out basis in relation to other requests in the same track.  Simple requests usually receive a response in approximately one month, whereas complex requests take longer than a month to complete.  At this time, your request has been assigned to the complex track. We regret the necessity of this delay, but please be assured that your request will be processed as soon as possible.  If you have any questions, you may contact our FOIA Requester Service Center at (571) 776-2300 or e-mail your correspondence to DEA.FOIA@dea.gov. In addition, you may contact our FOIA Public Liaison at (571) 776-2300 for any further assistance and to discuss any aspect of your request.  Additionally, you may contact the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) at the National Archives and Records Administration to inquire about the FOIA mediation services they offer.  The contact information for OGIS is as follows: Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, Room 2510, 8601 Adelphi Road, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001; e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at (202) 741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448; or facsimile at (202) 741-5769. Sincerely, 
Deshelia Wallace Expert Government Information Specialist Intake Sub-Unit FOIA/PA Unit Drug Enforcement Administration Telephone: 571-776-2300 E-mail: DEA.FOIA@dea.gov 
PRIVACY ACT NOTICE:  This e-mail (including any attachments herein) may contain personal and privileged information that requires protection in compliance with the Privacy Act of 1974 (5 U.S.C. § 552a).  Any use of this information by anyone other than the intended recipient is prohibited.  If you have received this communication in error, please immediately delete all copies of this information and notify me by e-mail.  The use, dissemination, distribution, or reproduction of this communication by unintended recipients is not authorized and may be unlawful.

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

- All records regarding projects to install bike racks on the Portland to Spokane section of the Empire Builder between 1 January 2017 and 1 August 2023.
- All records regarding projects to facilitate carry on bike service on the Portland to Spokane section of the Empire Builder between 1 January 2017 and 1 August 2023.

The existence of such information is suggested by responses provided by Amtrak to The League of American Bicyclists in 2017. The responses can be found on pages 16 and 22 respectively in this document: https://bikeleague.org/sites/default/files/Amtrak_answers.pdf

title: BOP FOIA 2023-03329 meta FOIA

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Michael Cohen through his lawyer filed a FOIA request and got nothing back. https://x.com/michaelcohen212/status/1692609200583541078?s=46&t=axhEpTt0OokaaS32ajEiQA. We are unable to tell why. So, I am requesting these records: 

1. The FOIA request which you assigned tracking number 2023-03329

2. The tracking sheet your agency used to track the progress of this FOIA request 

3. Any agency communications describing whether and how to respond to this FOIA request 

and 

4. A copy of the documents that responsive to the FOIA request. For this part, please note that some may need to be partially redacted. In your adjudication letter, you threw in a laundry list of exemption codes, but these likely don’t justify withholding 873 pages in full. For B7A specifically, the mere pendency of enforcement proceedings is an inadequate basis for the invocation of B7(A) with showing that some distinct harm could reasonably be expected to result if the record or information requested were disclosed. Miller v. USDA, 13 F.3d 260, 263 (8th Cir. 1993)

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Hoppock

title: FOIL: GenAI

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: FOIL: GenAI
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Specifically, I am seeking the following information related to the Pleasantville Union Free School District's approach to generative AI, as outlined in Dr. Cameron Fadjo's recent presentation:

1. Minutes and Documents of the Generative AI Task Force: Any minutes, agendas, and documents related to the three meetings held in the spring of 2023, including ideas, concerns, and recommendations discussed.
2. Technology & Innovation Committee Records: Records of meetings, agendas, and recommendations related to generative AI from the standing district committee.
3. Staff Training Materials: Materials and guidelines used to train staff on the basics of generative AI.
4. Policies on Generative AI Usage: Information on the district's policies regarding the use of generative AI tools by staff and students, including privacy concerns and access restrictions.
5. Draft Position Statement: Any drafts or plans related to the district's upcoming position statement on the use of generative AI.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

All documents mentioning Crass - the English punk band and art collective active since ~1977 ( see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crass ).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

J Ader

title: Jeffrey S. Broome, Chief Legal Officer of AdventHealth Corporate

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Jeffrey S. Broome, Chief Legal Officer of AdventHealth Corporate
communications.communication:
Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records related to Jeffrey S. Bromme in his professional capacity as an attorney, he is an employee of AdventHealth  (also known as Adventist Health System and formerly known as Florida Hospital) as Chief Legal Officer and is or was a member of the Texas Bar, from 2010 to 2023 (present day).  In the event that this request is overly broad or produces results in excess of 100, please let me know and I will clarify further. It is noted after reviewing responsive documents from the Florida Bar Association, that he is or was a member of the State of Texas Bar.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that fees cannot be waived, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request, though I grant permission for fees up to $25. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available. I request that any records maintained in an electronic format be provided in that same format (such as a PDF, CSV or XLS file), to avoid copying costs. If that is not possible, I prefer a CD-ROM or a USB drive as a secondary alternative.

I would also appreciate an approximate time frame for this request to  be processed.

If you deny any part of this request, please cite each specific exemption you think justifies your refusal to release the information and notify me of appeal procedures available under the law.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Bailey Pillon
